Subjective: Constipation x 3 months. Hard stools, difficult to pass. Straining. No bowel movement for 2-3 days at a time. Abdominal cramping, worse with palpation. Bloating. No change in diet, eats little due to low appetite. Underweight, but no recent weight loss. No blood in stool. Tried olive oil, softened stool but not permanent solution. No family hx of similar bowel issues, sister has UC but different symptoms. Urination normal. Menstrual periods regular. Impact on daily life: Unpleasant, painful bowel movements. Request: Wants to know if concerned, what to do, how to soften stool.
Objective: Abdomen: Bowel sounds normal. Tympany noted on percussion, some dullness on percussion over LLQ. Palpation: LLQ tender. No tenderness in renal lodges or RUQ/RLQ. No rebound tenderness. No guarding.
Assessment: Chronic constipation, likely functional/IBS-C. Underweight status to be addressed at follow-up.
Plan:
1. Psyllium fiber sachets: 1 daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks. 
2. Discuss weight/diet with dietitian at next visit. 
3. Safety netting: Return sooner if worsening abdominal pain, fever, or significant blood in stool. 
4. Follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate response to fiber.
